page.title: 07SALESBURY,ST.PETER'S,SCHOOL.
page.content: The original School building,now Junior 4 classroom and the caretakers home,is an L-shaped,stone,typically National Society building first used in 1850. It replaced a small, two storey Church erected building on the opposite side of Lovely Hall Lane. There were no cloakrooms and the scholars coats hung on hooks around the rooms.There were open ditches on both sides of the Lane and under the hedges on the Common,and these served as toilets and washrooms.The Board Inspectors well might have marvelled to see tha beautiful,clean needlework, exercise and copy books. The Tables,with the Creed,the Lord's Prayer and the Ten Commandments were removed from the classroom walls in 1938.The original fireplace remains, hidden behind the blackboard.
